title: Html injection mycrypto.com
vulnerability_information:
Hello. I remembered that a couple of months ago I found an HTML injection vulnerability on myetherwallet.com, I sent it, but my message was ignored. Since you have the same interface, I decided to check this vulnerability on your site and it was reproduced. The vulnerability works both on www.mycrypto.com and on mycrypto.com. Html injection is in a pop-up message  
You are successfully connected
URL: https://www.mycrypto.com/?txHash=qwqwq%3C%20SRC=%22jav ascript: alert (0); "& gt; qwqw # check- tx-status
Network: ETH provided by mycryptoapi.com Unfortunately, you have filtering there, I could not execute js and could hardly display a picture with href on the page. ## PoC https://mycrypto.com/?txHash=qwqwq%3C%20SRC=%22jav ascript:alert(0);"> qwqw#check-tx-status ##PoC video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JmP9AU8sX5k . ##Impact Since your site and myetherwallet are often subjected to phishing attacks, this vulnerability is dangerous. You can put in the href url of the phishing site, then you can steal the private key of the victim. Perhaps you can upload js to the site, but I could not do it. ## Impact Since your site and myetherwallet are often subjected to phishing attacks, this vulnerability is dangerous. You can put in the href url of the phishing site, then you can steal the private key of the victim. Perhaps you can upload js to the site, but I could not do it.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello. I remembered that a couple of months ago I found an HTML injection vulnerability on myetherwallet.com, I sent it, but my message was ignored.
Since you have the same interface, I decided to check this vulnerability on your site and it was reproduced. The vulnerability works both on www.mycrypto.com and on mycrypto.com.
Html injection is in a pop-up message

 <div class = "alert-message ng-binding" ng-bind-html = "alert.message"> You are successfully connected
<br> URL: <strong> https://www.mycrypto.com/?txHash=qwqwq%3C%20SRC=%22jav
ascript: alert (0); "& gt; <a href="https://securityz.net"> <img src =" https://securityz.net/mycrypto.jpeg "> </a> qwqw # check- tx-status </ strong> <br> Network: <strong> ETH </ strong> provided by <strong> mycryptoapi.com </ strong> </ div>

Unfortunately, you have filtering there, I could not execute js and could hardly display a picture with href on the page.

PoC

https://mycrypto.com/?txHash=qwqwq%3C%20SRC=%22javascript:alert(0);%22%3E <a href="https://securityz.net"><img src="https://securityz.net/mycrypto.jpeg"></a>qwqw#check-tx-status

PoC video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JmP9AU8sX5k .

Impact

Since your site and myetherwallet are often subjected to phishing attacks, this vulnerability is dangerous. You can put in the href url of the phishing site, then you can steal the private key of the victim. Perhaps you can upload js to the site, but I could not do it.

Impact

Since your site and myetherwallet are often subjected to phishing attacks, this vulnerability is dangerous. You can put in the href url of the phishing site, then you can steal the private key of the victim. Perhaps you can upload js to the site, but I could not do it.

activities.message:
Hi,

I'm not able to reproduce by clicking on your example link. Do you mind checking to see what the issue might be?

We will investigate independently as well. 

Thanks,
Daniel
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message: Here is the PoC link https://goo.gl/AMqx5T
activities.markdown_message: Here is the PoC link https://goo.gl/AMqx5T

activities.message:
Thank you, I am now able to reproduce.

This is indeed an issue, and we will start working on a fix immediately. 

Thanks,

Daniel
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you, I am now able to reproduce.

This is indeed an issue, and we will start working on a fix immediately.

Thanks,

Daniel

activities.message: The fact that you will fix this vulnerability is great, but what about myetherwallet? I would like to disclose this report publicly after the fix, but if I disclose it, I will also disclose the vulnerability on myetherwallet.com and there may be massive cash theft.
activities.markdown_message: The fact that you will fix this vulnerability is great, but what about myetherwallet? I would like to disclose this report publicly after the fix, but if I disclose it, I will also disclose the vulnerability on myetherwallet.com and there may be massive cash theft.

activities.message:
We are not affiliated with myetherwallet.com, but I will reach out via my personal contact information to make sure he is informed about your report.

You may also reach out independently of course.
activities.markdown_message:
We are not affiliated with myetherwallet.com, but I will reach out via my personal contact information to make sure he is informed about your report.

You may also reach out independently of course.

activities.message:
Thank you again for your report. We believe this issue is now resolved. We have coordinated with MyEtherWallet to have them address and deploy the fix at the same time.

Thank you for the responsible disclosure!
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you again for your report. We believe this issue is now resolved. We have coordinated with MyEtherWallet to have them address and deploy the fix at the same time.

Thank you for the responsible disclosure!

activities.message: I confirm the vulnerability fix on mycrypto and myetherwallet. Can we disclose it?
activities.markdown_message: I confirm the vulnerability fix on mycrypto and myetherwallet. Can we disclose it?

activities.message:
Hi w2w,

Thank you for the responsible disclosure. 

We don't currently have any policies against disclosure after vulnerabilities have been patched, however you are the first so far to ask for disclosure permission.

Would it be possible to make a join statement or otherwise participate in your disclosure process so that our users can be best kept up to date?

Best,
Daniel
activities.markdown_message:
Hi w2w,

Thank you for the responsible disclosure.

We don't currently have any policies against disclosure after vulnerabilities have been patched, however you are the first so far to ask for disclosure permission.

Would it be possible to make a join statement or otherwise participate in your disclosure process so that our users can be best kept up to date?

Best,
Daniel

activities.message: I do not quite understand your question. You say that users can be updated, but this is not a vulnerability in the software, it's just html injection in a web application. And it is fixed, if you open the report, it does not hurt your users.
activities.markdown_message: I do not quite understand your question. You say that users can be updated, but this is not a vulnerability in the software, it's just html injection in a web application. And it is fixed, if you open the report, it does not hurt your users.

activities.message:
Hi w2w,

I've learned more about the HackerOne disclosure process, as I previously was unaware that you could disclose directly through the platform.
 
The issue is indeed fixed, and users will no longer be vulnerable. We thank you for making MyCrypto more secure!

I have disclosed the issue publicly per your request.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi w2w,

I've learned more about the HackerOne disclosure process, as I previously was unaware that you could disclose directly through the platform.

The issue is indeed fixed, and users will no longer be vulnerable. We thank you for making MyCrypto more secure!

I have disclosed the issue publicly per your request.
